item.title: Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

item.title: H.R. 515, Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as introduced on February 2, 2005

item.title: H.R. 515, Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as introduced on February 2, 2005

summary.text:
Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005 - Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to make available to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for programs, functions, and activities of the Veterans Health Administration for FY 2007 130 percent of the amount obligated during FY 2005. Adjusts the amount provided for fiscal years after FY 2007 based on the number of enrolled veterans and the number of other persons eligible but not enrolled who are provided care, multiplied by the per capital baseline amount for FY 2005, as increased by the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index.

Prohibits the availability of such funds for: (1) construction, acquisition, or alteration of veterans' medical facilities (other than for repairs provided for before the date of enactment of this Act); or (2) grants for the construction of State home facilities for the furnishing of veterans' domiciliary, nursing home, and hospital care.

bill.title: Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005

item.title: Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005
Assured Funding for Veterans Health Care Act of 2005
To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for an assured adequate level of funding for veterans health care.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
